thread.title: Orange hopes to improve defensively against Virginia
thread.title_full: Orange hopes to improve defensively against Virginia

title: Orange hopes to improve defensively against Virginia
text:
Orange hopes to improve defensively against Virginia 
By wbng sports Orange hopes to improve defensively against Virginia October 15, 2015 Updated Oct 15, 2015 at 11:43 PM EDT 
Syracuse, NY (WBNG Binghamton) At 3-2 and 1-0 in ACC play, Syracuse looks to be in a pretty good position with the non-conference portion of his schedule finished. But coming off back-to-back losses, there are some concerns. 
One of those issues has been the defense. 
SU gave up a season worst 45 points to USF last Saturday. In the two losses to LSU and South Florida the Orange defense has given up touchdowns of 62, 42 and 45 yards. 
Coach Scott Shafer knows they have to clean things up. 
"Just got to keep teaching those young guys how to play team defense," said Shafer in his press conference on Thursday. "Some of those big plays were short throws that turned into bigger runs and we didn't do a good job leveraging and playing with good angles. So we've tried to work on those things by fabricating drills in practice that tend to those issues, but got to get rid of them." 
On Saturday Syracuse travels to Virginia for a 3:30 p.m. kick. 
The Cavaliers are only 1-4 this year, but that record is a bit deceiving. Two of those losses came to Top 25 teams, Notre Dame and UCLA.
